title: Digital Technology-Integrated Learning Design for Professional Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Professional knowledge related to job duties and basic digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: Custom-designed for social sector professionals. Emphasizes integrating digital technologies into workplace contexts through reflective and holistic learning approaches

learning_goals: Learners can compare at least three digital tools (e.g., Notion, Slack, Trello, Google Workspace) per job type (planning, sales, operations, management), design at least two workflow improvement plans using selected tools, and submit a final report reflecting team feedback.

Over a 6-month course, learners analyze at least three real corporate cases applying digital technologies (e.g., AI, RPA, data analysis tools), document problem-solving strategies using a reflective thinking framework, and achieve over 80% suitability through peer evaluation.

Over a 6-month course, learners analyze at least three comprehensive learning design cases utilizing digital technologies (e.g., AI, big data analysis tools), evaluate the impact of these technologies on professional development using five criteria (efficiency, effectiveness, innovativeness, etc.), and write a report including two improvement suggestions.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
